TopicTitle: Just need a single quick stock resized part....

Articles.Content:
what i need right now is the stock truss girder adapter to be resized for 0.625 Parts...

i when i tried to do it myself i would, for some reason, get crashes

so just asking...

What did your cfg look like ?

Edited December 18, 2014 by Mecripp2

Nevermind i found an old download that should work fine for my purposes and also MeCripp...

PART

{

name = trussAdapter

module = Part

author = NovaSilisko

mesh = model.mu

rescaleFactor = 0.5

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.2054152.5, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1

node_stack_top = 0.0, 0.3246852, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1

TechRequired = specializedConstruction

entryCost = 2400

cost = 25

category = Structural

subcategory = 0

title = Small Modular Girder Adapter

manufacturer = Maxo Construction Toys

description = This piece allows you to attach Modular Girder parts to standard 0.625m attachment points.

attachRules = 1,0,1,1,0

// --- standard part parameters ---

mass = 0.125

dragModelType = default

maximum_drag = 0.2

minimum_drag = 0.2

angularDrag = 1

crashTolerance = 80

breakingForce = 200

breakingTorque = 200

maxTemp = 5000

}

just tested and this works 

+PART[trussAdapter]
{
    @name =  0.625_trussAdapter
    @title =  0.625m Modular Girder Adapter
    @description = This piece allows you to attach Modular Girder parts to standard 0.625m attachment points.


    %scale = 1
    %rescaleFactor = 0.625

    @mass = 0.125
}

EDIT- Might have to play with the # to get it to look right.

EDIT- Hope it help and .5 looks good on some

Edited December 18, 2014 by Mecripp2

just tested and this works 
+PART[trussAdapter]
{
    @name =  0.625_trussAdapter
    @title =  0.625m Modular Girder Adapter
    @description = This piece allows you to attach Modular Girder parts to standard 0.625m attachment points.


    %scale = 1
    %rescaleFactor = 0.625

    @mass = 0.125
}

EDIT- Might have to play with the # to get it to look right.

thanks actually because apparently the new part cfgs i found were the same as my originally so much appreciated

Edit: wait i just need to make sure, where exactly do i put the cfg?

Now it Works Thanks MeCripp also here is what i was trying to build with it

its not snug but it's close enough
What are them parts from ? and you can play around with the # to get a better fit.
You might be interested in TweakScale. It'll allow you to scale nearly every part in the game.

Yes TweakScale is good for something but something just look better if you change the scale, Just because you tell it it's .625 doesn't mean it will look good on all .625 parts so you can play with the # alittle, Be nice if TweakScale had a better fine tune scale range.

EDIT- Or is there away to use TweakScale to change in smaller # like in .25 at a time ?
